title.narrative: Indo-German Support project for Climate Action in India

description.narrative: The project supports theMinistry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) with the coordination and implementation of Indian climate and biodiversity policies. The project aims to strengthen capacities of selected decision makers at the national and state level to develop innovative approaches for implementation of India’s NDCs and far-reaching climate policy. It promotes a climate co-benefits approach to address untapped potentials for strengthening Indian NDC. The project develops models for public-private sector collaboration implementing demonstration projects in selected states to establish a climate co-benefit roadmap. Aligned to priorities of the MoEFCC, project activities focus on two selected areas: circular economy and biodiversity. The project implements the interface function for IKI projects in India to foster syn-ergies within the BMU portfolio in India and ensure knowledge management to-wards the BMU. At the same time, it supports the climate and biodiversity dialogue between Germany and India in the context of the 2030 Agenda and the Indo-German Environmental Forum, in particular the joint working groups under this um-brella.
